item.title: Ticket #2728 (Incorrect DIV tags in default theme files) created
item.dc:creator: deko
item.description:
In regard to the default theme in version 2.0.2 -

This div tag: 

<div class="entrytext">

has no corresponding entry in the stylesheet (style.css).

See:

line 15 in: wordpress/themes/default/single.php

and

line 8 in: wordpress/themes/default/page.php

perhaps other files as well.

This bug results in incorrectly formatted Page entries, perhaps other formatting issues.

Was the tag intended to be 'entry' rather than 'entrytext'?

item.title: Ticket #2701 (Centralize javascript inclusions) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Ideally, people could use it to deal with JS in their themes and plugins as well. It gets called by the wp_head hook.

item.title: Ticket #2701 (Centralize javascript inclusions) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: This only needs to be loaded for the admin, right? I think it only needs to be loaded when admin-header.php is loaded. Maybe add WP_Scripts and friends to wp-admin/script-loader.php and include it from admin-header.php.

item.title: Ticket #2701 (Centralize javascript inclusions) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
As for the best place for the classes, I don't know. classes.php is fine, if that's where people want them.

2701e.diff

  1. Oops: stray var_dump() fixed.

item.title: Ticket #2701 (Centralize javascript inclusions) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Good call. Thanks.

2701d.diff

  1. Ditch array_combine(). Use something less complicated.

item.title: 2701d.diff attached to Ticket #2701
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Just say no to array_combine(). Fixes bug found by ryanscheuermann.

item.title: Ticket #2727 (Import from WP XML does not handle categories correctly) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe

item.title: 2727.diff attached to Ticket #2727
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Fix for categories in WP import

item.title: Ticket #2727 (Import from WP XML does not handle categories correctly) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: A typo in the import script keeps any categories from being imported.

item.title: Ticket #2726 (irc://irc.server.org cannot be written into a post / link) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Keywords, Owner, Status, Severity, Milestone changed

It is not correct to conclude that "IRC can't be linked from a blog." You just have to be an admin so that your HMTL isn't filtered by KSES.

A patch is attached. Is there any reason an admin would not want this as an allowed protocol?
